properties.name: Auschwitz concentration camp
properties.description: Posted by TrevmisterKrakow, PolandAuschwitz was the largest of all German death camps during WWII. Ninety percent of the 1.1 million people who were killed here were Jews. The camp usually held 13,000 to 16,000 prisoners. There were four gas chambers located here. Mass numbers of killings took place everyday here. On January 27,1945 the camp was liberated.

properties.name: Birmingham Civil Rights Institute
properties.description: Posted by TrevmisterÂ 520 16th St N, Birmingham, ALBirmingham got the nickname of Tragic City in the 1960s. This is because of all the commotion caused by the issue of segregation. Many black people were beat, injured, and severely mistreated. The Birmingham incident is reported to be one of the worst times during the civil rights movement.

properties.name: Charleston, SC, USA
properties.description: Posted by TrevmisterCharleston, SC, USA

properties.name: Ellis Island
properties.description: Posted by TrevmisterEllis Island, New YorkThe ports of New York near Ellis island have been the most used places in the U.S. for immigrants. Over 100 million Americans are reported to be related directly to someone who came through Ellis Island. It is reported that over 22 million immigrants came to America through Ellis Island. This happened during the peak of the immigration years between 1892 and 1924.

properties.name: Key West
properties.description: Posted by TrevmisterUnited St.Key west is best known for it\'s great variety of fishing and also for being the souther-most point of Florida. It has wonderful ocean scenery and many beautiful reefs. This place is full of many tourist attractions. The Ernest Hemingway Museum and the Shipwreck Museums are very well known.

properties.name: Leaning Tower of Pisa
properties.description: Posted by TrevmisterPisa, ItalyThis tower is the bell tower of the Italian Cathedral. It was started in August of 1173. About 200 years is the estimated time it took to build the structure. The Leaning Tower of Pisa is one of the most intriguing bell towers in Italy. There have been more than one occasion that columns and other pieces of the building had to be replaced.

properties.name: Mount Rushmore
properties.description: Posted by Trevmistersouth dAKOTAMount Rushmore contains the faces of George Washington, Thomas Jefferson, Theodore Roosevelt, and Abraham Lincoln. The mountain represents the first 150 years of U.S. history. In Keystone, South Dakota 5,725 feet above sea level is where the mountain stands, and it covers 1,278 acres of land. Once finished in 1941, Mount Rushmore became a landmark for the U.S.

properties.name: Statue of Liberty
properties.description: Posted by TrevmisterLiberty Island New York, NYThe Statue of Liberty was dedicated to the United States by the French in 1886. It was given as a sign of freedom. The statue is made up of over 350 individual pieces. The many pieces were put into 214 different crates and shipped from France to the U.S. The steel structure is coated with copper.

properties.name: The Grand Canyon
properties.description: Posted by TrevmisterArizonaThis great canyon was carved out by the Colorado River. It is very long at 277 miles long. The widths vary from 4 to 18 miles wide. It is one of the United States best known tourist attractions. Eighty-three percent of the visitors each year are from America. The other 17% are from places such as Japan, Germany, and the United Kingdon.

properties.name: University of Florida
properties.description: Posted by TrevmisterUniversity of FlaIt is Floridas largest university, and has traces that it was started by a small seminary in 1853. The University of Florida has about 50,000 students and contains 16 colleges and over 150 research centers. In the years 2006-2007 the Florida basketball team won back to back championships. Also in the year 2007 the football team won the BCS title.

properties.name: the alamo
properties.description: Posted by Trevmistersan antonio, texasJames Bowie, David Crockett, and William B. Travis are the people who are best known for fighting in The Alamo. It was actually an old church. The date that it fell was March 6, 1836. More than 2.5 million people visit the place each year. The whole land area is only 4.2 acres
